agno3.appearance_ru: Colorless crystals that darken when exposed to light
agno3.storage_ru: Store in a dark place, in sealed containers, away from organic substances
agno3.industrial_ru: Production of photographic materials, mirrors, and antiseptics
fun_facts_ru: Lunar caustic (silver nitrate) is used in medicine for cauterizing wounds
Leaves permanent black stains on skin due to reduction to metallic silver

al2o3.production_ru: Processing of bauxite using the Bayer process
fun_facts_ru: Corundum, ruby, and sapphire are natural forms of Al₂O₃, colored by impurities
One of the hardest oxides — 9 on the Mohs scale

al_oh_3.production_ru: Precipitation from aluminium salt solutions using alkali
fun_facts_ru: Found in many antacid medications (heartburn remedies)
Decomposes into Al₂O₃ and water when heated

bacl2.storage_ru: Store in sealed containers in a ventilated area
bacl2.industrial_ru: Reagent for detecting sulfate ions in analytical chemistry
bacl2.production_ru: Reaction of barium carbonate with hydrochloric acid
fun_facts_ru: A qualitative reagent for sulfate ions — produces a white precipitate of BaSO₄

baso4.industrial_ru: Radiocontrast agent, filler in paper and plastics manufacturing
baso4.production_ru: Precipitation from barium salt solutions using sulfuric acid or sulfates
fun_facts_ru: Used as a 'barium meal' for stomach X-rays — insoluble and non-toxic
The mineral barite (BaSO₄) is the main industrial source of barium

caco3.production_ru: Mining of natural minerals (limestone, chalk, marble)
fun_facts_ru: Chalk, marble, limestone, seashells, and eggshells are all CaCO₃
Decomposes into CaO and CO₂ when heated — the basis of lime production

ca_oh_2.production_ru: Slaking quicklime with water: CaO + H₂O → Ca(OH)₂
fun_facts_ru: Limewater (Ca(OH)₂ solution) is a qualitative reagent for CO₂: it turns cloudy when carbon dioxide is passed through it
Slaked lime has been used in construction for over 5,000 years

hazards_ru: Causes burns on contact with moist skin
cao.storage_ru: Store in sealed containers, protect from moisture
cao.production_ru: Calcination of limestone at 900–1200 °C: CaCO₃ → CaO + CO₂
fun_facts_ru: Quicklime heats up intensely on contact with water — the reaction is highly exothermic
One of the oldest binding materials used in construction

co2.industrial_ru: Carbonation of beverages, fire extinguishing, soda production
co2.production_ru: Byproduct of fuel combustion, alcoholic fermentation, and limestone calcination
fun_facts_ru: Dry ice is solid CO₂; it sublimes at −78.5 °C, bypassing the liquid phase
CO₂ makes up about 0.04% of Earth's atmosphere, yet it is a key greenhouse gas

cu_oh_2.industrial_ru: Production of fungicides (Bordeaux mixture), reagent in analytical chemistry
cu_oh_2.production_ru: Precipitation from copper(II) salt solutions using alkali
fun_facts_ru: Turns black when heated, decomposing into CuO and water
Dissolves in ammonia to form a bright blue solution (Schweizer's reagent)

cuo.industrial_ru: Production of ceramics, pigments, and catalysts
cuo.production_ru: Calcination of copper(II) hydroxide or heating copper in air
fun_facts_ru: Easily reduced by hydrogen to metallic copper — a classic school chemistry experiment

cuso4.production_ru: Dissolving copper in dilute sulfuric acid with heating and air exposure
fun_facts_ru: The pentahydrate CuSO₄·5H₂O (blue vitriol) is bright blue; it loses water on heating and turns white
Anhydrous CuSO₄ is used as a moisture indicator — it turns blue on contact with water

fe2o3.industrial_ru: Metallurgy (ore for pig iron production), pigments, polishing powders
fe2o3.production_ru: Roasting of pyrite (FeS₂) or calcination of iron(III) hydroxide
fun_facts_ru: The mineral hematite (Fe₂O₃) is the main iron ore on Earth
The red color of Martian soil is caused by the presence of Fe₂O₃

fecl3.appearance_ru: Dark brown crystals, deliquescent in air
fecl3.industrial_ru: Wastewater treatment, printed circuit board etching, catalyst
fecl3.production_ru: Reaction of iron with chlorine gas at elevated temperature
fun_facts_ru: FeCl₃ solution is a qualitative reagent for phenols (produces a violet coloration)

fe_oh_3.production_ru: Precipitation from iron(III) salt solutions using alkali
fun_facts_ru: Has no melting point — decomposes into Fe₂O₃ and water when heated
Rust is a mixture of hydrated iron oxides with a composition close to Fe(OH)₃

feso4.industrial_ru: Water purification, ink production, agriculture (micronutrient fertilizer)
feso4.production_ru: Dissolving iron in dilute sulfuric acid
fun_facts_ru: The heptahydrate FeSO₄·7H₂O is known as green vitriol — one of the oldest known chemical compounds

h2co3.appearance_ru: Exists only in aqueous solution; colorless liquid
h2co3.industrial_ru: Carbonated beverages contain dissolved CO₂, which forms carbonic acid
h2co3.production_ru: Dissolving CO₂ in water: CO₂ + H₂O ⇌ H₂CO₃
fun_facts_ru: One of the most unstable acids — decomposes into water and CO₂ almost instantly
The fizzing of carbonated drinks is CO₂ being released as carbonic acid decomposes

h2o.industrial_ru: Universal solvent used in all branches of industry
fun_facts_ru: The only substance on Earth found naturally in all three states of matter
Ice is less dense than liquid water — an anomalous property without which aquatic life in winter would be impossible
The water molecule has a bent geometry with a bond angle of 104.5°

h2so4.storage_ru: Store in glass or polyethylene containers, away from alkalis
h2so4.industrial_ru: Production of fertilizers, batteries, and detergents
h2so4.production_ru: Contact process: sulfur combustion → SO₂ → SO₃ → H₂SO₄
fun_facts_ru: Sulfuric acid is called the 'bread of chemistry' — it is used in nearly all chemical manufacturing
When diluting, always add acid to water, never the reverse — otherwise violent boiling occurs

h3po4.industrial_ru: Production of mineral fertilizers, food additive (E338), anti-corrosion treatment
h3po4.production_ru: Extraction or thermal processing of apatites and phosphorites
fun_facts_ru: Found in Coca-Cola and other soft drinks as an acidity regulator (E338)
Phosphoric acid is triprotic — it can form three series of salts

hcl.appearance_ru: Colorless liquid with a pungent odor (in solution)
hcl.storage_ru: Store in glass or polyethylene containers in a well-ventilated area
hcl.industrial_ru: Metal cleaning, chloride production, food industry
hcl.production_ru: Synthesis from hydrogen and chlorine, or as a byproduct of organic chlorination
fun_facts_ru: Hydrochloric acid is present in human gastric juice (pH ≈ 1.5–2)
Concentrated HCl 'fumes' in air due to the release of gaseous HCl

hno3.appearance_ru: Colorless liquid with a pungent odor; fumes in air
hno3.storage_ru: Store in dark glass containers, away from organic substances
hno3.industrial_ru: Production of fertilizers (ammonium nitrate), explosives, and dyes
hno3.production_ru: Catalytic oxidation of ammonia over a platinum catalyst (Ostwald process)
fun_facts_ru: A mixture of HNO₃ and HCl (1:3) is 'aqua regia', which dissolves gold and platinum
Nitric acid turns skin yellow (xanthoproteic reaction with proteins)

kcl.industrial_ru: Production of potash fertilizers, medicine (salt substitute)
kcl.production_ru: Mining of natural minerals sylvite and carnallite
fun_facts_ru: The mineral sylvite (KCl) is the primary source of potash fertilizers
Used as a table salt substitute in dietary nutrition

koh.storage_ru: Store in sealed containers, protect from moisture and CO₂
koh.industrial_ru: Production of soft soap, electrolytes for alkaline batteries
fun_facts_ru: KOH is called 'caustic potash' — it readily destroys organic tissue
Absorbs CO₂ from the air, converting to potassium carbonate

mg_oh_2.production_ru: Precipitation from magnesium salt solutions using alkali
fun_facts_ru: Mg(OH)₂ is the active ingredient in 'Milk of Magnesia', used to treat heartburn
Decomposes into MgO and water when heated

na2co3.industrial_ru: Production of glass, soap, detergents, and cellulose
na2co3.production_ru: Solvay process (ammonia soda process) from NaCl and CaCO₃
fun_facts_ru: Soda ash (Na₂CO₃) is one of the most important products of the chemical industry
The decahydrate Na₂CO₃·10H₂O is known as 'washing soda'

na2o.storage_ru: Store in sealed containers, protect from moisture
na2o.industrial_ru: Component of glass batches, intermediate in NaOH production
na2o.production_ru: Heating sodium with limited oxygen supply
fun_facts_ru: Rapidly absorbs moisture and CO₂ from air, converting to Na₂CO₃

na2so4.industrial_ru: Production of glass, detergents, and cellulose
na2so4.production_ru: Reaction of sulfuric acid with sodium chloride, or from natural minerals
fun_facts_ru: The decahydrate Na₂SO₄·10H₂O (Glauber's salt) was discovered by Glauber in 1625 and was used as a laxative

nacl.industrial_ru: Food industry, soda and chlorine production (electrolysis)
nacl.production_ru: Mining of rock salt or evaporation of seawater
fun_facts_ru: Annual global consumption is about 300 million tonnes
In Ancient Rome, soldiers were sometimes paid in salt — hence the word 'salary'
NaCl crystals have a cubic shape, visible even in ordinary table salt

naoh.storage_ru: Store in sealed containers, protect from moisture
naoh.industrial_ru: Production of soap, paper, viscose; petroleum product refining
naoh.production_ru: Electrolysis of sodium chloride solution (chloralkali process)
fun_facts_ru: NaOH is called 'caustic soda' or 'lye'
Absorbs CO₂ and moisture from air, gradually converting to Na₂CO₃

nh3.appearance_ru: Colorless gas with a pungent odor
nh3.storage_ru: Store in steel cylinders in a well-ventilated area
nh3.industrial_ru: Production of nitrogen fertilizers, nitric acid, and explosives
nh3.production_ru: Synthesis from nitrogen and hydrogen at high pressure and temperature (Haber process)
fun_facts_ru: Smelling salts (ammonia solution) are used to revive people who have fainted
Ammonia is one of the most widely produced chemicals in the world (over 150 million tonnes/year)

pb_no3_2.storage_ru: Store in sealed containers, away from combustible materials, in a ventilated area
pb_no3_2.industrial_ru: Production of pigments, flotation reagents, pyrotechnics
pb_no3_2.production_ru: Dissolving lead or lead oxide in nitric acid
fun_facts_ru: One of the few soluble lead salts — most Pb²⁺ salts are insoluble
Decomposes when heated, releasing brown NO₂ gas

sio2.industrial_ru: Production of glass, ceramics, optical fiber, and electronics
sio2.production_ru: Mining of natural quartz sand; purification for electronics
fun_facts_ru: Quartz, rock crystal, amethyst, and agate are natural forms of SiO₂
SiO₂ is the basis of silicon chips that power all modern electronics
The most abundant mineral in the Earth's crust

so3.storage_ru: Store in sealed containers, protect from moisture
so3.industrial_ru: Intermediate product in the manufacture of sulfuric acid
so3.production_ru: Catalytic oxidation of SO₂ with atmospheric oxygen (contact process)
fun_facts_ru: SO₃ avidly absorbs water — when released into the atmosphere it forms sulfuric acid (acid rain)
A solution of SO₃ in sulfuric acid is called oleum

zno.appearance_ru: White powder; turns yellow when heated
zno.industrial_ru: Rubber production (vulcanization), zinc white pigment, cosmetics, pharmaceuticals
zno.production_ru: Oxidation of zinc vapor with atmospheric oxygen
fun_facts_ru: Found in zinc ointment — an antiseptic skin treatment
Turns yellow when heated and white again when cooled — a thermochromic effect
